task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Tesla Model 3\LOG\3F78A21D\00000001. Save the concatenated file as Tesla_Model_3_3F78A21D.mf4 in the same folder. GUI instructions: open the folder in the file dialog, click any file to focus the list, press CTRL+A to select all files, then press ENTER to load them.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf window so subsequent State-Tool queries and interactions target the correct application
Capture the current UI to discover the Mode menu and other controls before interacting
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (use dynamic element coordinates discovered by State-Tool)
Discover the 'Batch processing' menu item exposed by the Mode menu
Select Batch processing mode so multiple files can be concatenated
Get the Batch processing view UI to locate the 'Add files' control
Open the file-selection dialog to add multiple .MF4 files for the batch operation
Capture the file dialog UI elements (address/file name field and file list) so we can navigate to the target folder
Focus the file name / address input in the dialog so we can type the full folder path
Enter the exact folder path (single backslashes) into the dialog and press Enter to open that folder
After navigating, refresh the dialog state to discover the listed .MF4 files in that folder
Click any .MF4 file in the list to focus the file list (using wildcard to match any .MF4 entry discovered by State-Tool)
Select all .MF4 files in the folder per the user's instruction to prepare them for loading
Confirm the selection and load all selected files into the Batch processing list
Inspect the Batch view to confirm files are loaded and to discover controls for selecting the batch operation and setting output filename
Open the operation selector so we can choose the Concatenate operation (use dynamic element reference discovered by State-Tool)
Find the 'Concatenate' operation option exposed by the operation selector
Select Concatenate as the batch operation to merge all loaded files into a single continuous measurement
Locate the output filename input control (or File name edit) in the Batch processing UI before typing the desired output path
Focus the output filename input so we can enter the full output path and filename
Enter the full output path and filename using single backslashes to ensure the concatenated file is saved in the same folder with the requested name
Discover the button to start the batch operation (Start or Save) before triggering it
Begin the concatenation process (if UI shows 'Start'); if the UI instead exposed 'Save', the previous State-Tool would reveal that and the element reference will be used instead
Confirm the batch operation started and monitor for completion or any dialogs (errors, overwrite prompts) that may require further interaction

Switch to Batch processing mode, add the files from the specified folder using the file dialog, select all files, choose the Concatenate operation, set the output filename to the requested path, and start the batch. Each interaction is preceded by State-Tool to discover dynamic UI elements and uses element references (including wildcard for .MF4 files) to avoid hardcoded coordinates. This sequence follows the documented Batch processing workflow and the user's file-selection instructions.
